comments: On a 2n X (n^2 - n + 1) X n^2 cuboid (with n >= 3) there are six pairs of points with the maximum surface distance between them: the four pairs of opposite corners and the opposite pairs of points on the smallest faces 1 in from the mid-points of the shortest edges; this maximum surface distance is sqrt(a(n)).
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
crossrefs: For n >= 2 the sequence is a subsequence of A007692.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jan 11 2001
